Dear Mr. Whalen:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-
6992.

ALLEGATION:
Facility currently has several financial risk factors.
INVESTIGATION:
The Chief Administrator submitted the third-party audit for the fiscal year ending
September 30, 2020. The Bureau of Audit reviewed the submitted documentation and
authored a report. The report indicated that Teaching Family Homes has a decline in
total net assets, has negative working capital, is operating with a low ration, and has a
deficit in unrestricted net assets. All of these factors indicate that the facility is in a
declining financial condition.
The Board President was interviewed via telephone on September 8, 2021.The
Board President acknowledged he is aware of the financial concerns outlined in the
third-party audit and is currently working with the board members to establish a
balanced budget for the next fiscal year. The Board President reported they have a
loan forgiveness program they are working with and expect to have a portion of their
debt forgiven within the next quarter.
2

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4108 Financing and audit.
A licensee shall do all of the following:
(c) Demonstrate sufficient financing to assure that
proper care of residents is provided and that licensing rules
are followed.
ANALYSIS: After review of the third-party audit as well as the report from the
Bureau of Audit it is determined that Teaching Family Homes
currently is in a declining financial condition.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, I recommend no change in the
First Provisional License Status.
